required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Tolsura When Used as Prophylaxis After Lung Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Tolsura When Used as Prophylaxis After Lung Transplantation

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-center, observational study of Tolsura PK sampling in lung transplant recipients

detailed_description.textblock: Patients who are receiving Tolsura as part of their clinical care will be asked to enroll and EMR data and excess biological samples will be collected

primary_outcome.measure: PK Sampling-measure amount of drug in system
primary_outcome.description: blood samples around a dosing of Tolsura to determine maximum plasma concentration

secondary_outcome.measure: rates of infection post treatment with Tolsura
secondary_outcome.description: follow lung transplant recipients till end of Tolsura treatment and determine rates of infection for as well as type of infections

arm_group.description: Lung transplants on Tolsura for infection

intervention.intervention_name: EMR Collection on use and outcomes of Tolsura
intervention.description: Patients fulfilling the inclusion criteria (see above) and placed on Tolsura for prophylaxis, and signed informed consent to participate in this study will be part of the study.

biospec_descr.textblock: excess biological samples collected as part of the patient's clinical care will be obtained if available for further testing/analysis for amounts of Tolsura

study_pop.textblock: lung transplants on Tolsura that meet entry criteria

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years of age and older
- hospitalized at UPMC
- placed on Tolsura prophylactically by clinical team
- patients who have had or will have a lung transplant.
Exclusion Criteria:
- redo lung transplant
- recipient with dual liver-lung transplant
- patients with previous history of SOT
- including other organ transplantation
- patients with known pre-transplant colonization with moulds resistant to azoles
- patients with intra-transplant positive cultures for moulds in either transplant recipient or his/her donor
- patients with a history of hypersensitivity reaction to an azole agent
- patients who are kept NPO (nothing by mouth, including meds)
- recipients or donor with HepC PCR positive

patient_data.ipd_description: If data is shared all data provided de identified using alpha/numeric codes and MTA and/or DUA's will be in put in place prior to sharing
